revisionDesc.change: adapting line numbering system and app loc to new EG recommandations

div.p: // I śaka 1261, māghamāsa, tithi navamī kr̥ṣṇapakṣa, ma, U, A, vāra, vuye

Irikā divaśa rakryan· juru
puspadanta, mukuthavarṣaṇāmnaṅ aṁvyavahāra, makalaga mpu sāvitra tlas· pingat de saṁ mantrī tumapəl samudāya
mvaṁ saṁṅ upapati, makaprasthāvapati mpu sāvitra, sāhasāṅdalih i rakryan· juru puspadanta malap· lmaḥ kabha
gavānan· sapuluḥ liriḥ, maṅkana pakṣa mpu sāvitra,

kunaṁ pakṣa rakryan· juru puspadanta lmaḥ saṅke kuli§
t kaki Ikaṁ bhinuktinya sapuluḥ liriḥ, maṅkanāṁvivāda ya tika pinametakən pramāṇa, Inundaṁ taṁ sasiriṅan· sa
taṅgəḥnyaṁ kāliḥ makādi I sumbul·, liṁnyan tinañan·, siṅgiḥ pukulun· juru puspadanta madr̥vya Ikaṁ savaḥ-sa
vaḥ sapuluḥ liriḥ I sagiri, yapvan ikaṁ savaḥ kabhagavanan· sapuluḥ liriḥ muvaḥ, maṅkanājarnya makabehan·,

vva
ntən· ta pukulun· paṅhulu bañunya rvaṁ kupaṁ sovaṁ, kataṅgapan denikaṁ rāma sumbul·, vyaktyanyan bheda, muva§
h ajariṁkaṁ juru mantən· maṅaran gambyok·, Aki gaṇḍi yo pukulun· vka bhagavān· riṁ kr̥ta, muktyakən ikaṁ sa
puluḥ liriḥ juga, Antara saṅkerika, mpu kili nuda, vkasan saṁ mapañji śūrajaya muktyakən kabhagavānan katkeṁ
maṅke, kevalātutur ikaṁ sapuluḥ liriḥ juga, pisaniṅu vyāparāṅipikipika Ikaṁ savaḥ kaparathaniAn· nāṁ
sapuluḥ liriḥ, maṅkana varaḥ kihadyan· gambyok·, yatika pinramāṇakan saṁ mantrī samudāya, mataṁ
nyan· balavān· rakryan· juru puspadanta, sor mpu sāvitra, pratyeka saṅ amgat·, rakryan· raṅga Aki taṅga, muvah aki
kape, rakryan· kanuruhan· Aki joṁ, muvaḥ mahiṣāṅivuṁ, rakryan· tuməṅguṁ Aki makara, muvah aki raṅgāsəm-asəm·
, rakryan· dmuṁ Aki R̥ma, muvah aki goleṁ, rakryan apatiḥ ravi, muvaḥ rake mali, saṁ prāṇapati, makādhipati
saṅ āryya śūrasiṅha, muvaḥ saṁ bhujaṅga mantrī, saṁ mapañjy antaraga, saṁ mapañji cāyaguṇa, saṁ pamgət saliṅsiṅan·, makā
di saṁ mapañji surapati, muvaḥ saṁ pamgət i kaṇḍamuhi, samgət· pamvatan·, samaṅkana kveḥ saṅ amgat· ,,,

app.note: It would also be possible to read puṣpadanta. However, other instances of that name in this epigraph are consistently spelled with a dental s.

A second akṣara na is written above the ligature nta. The engraver would probably have realised that he was beginning to write too high, and stopped after the first akṣara, then rewrote nta at the proper place.

div.p: Unpublished inscription first read by Arlo Griffiths in 2009 by direct inspection of the plates at Rotterdam, and re-edited by Marine Schoettel and Arlo Griffiths in February-March 2020 from photographs made available by the Wereldmuseum (49509 and 49507).
